result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian D. J. Johnston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  Matintain full time work, school, or treatment.

Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Brian D. J. Johnston in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  William Albert Appleton appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 15CM61 and 15CM64. Sentencing argued. Court sentenced the defendant in 15CM61 to serve 9 months in jail   In 15CM64 30 days jail, concurrent to 15CM61.  A civil judgment will be entered for all unpaid financial obligations. In 15CM61 203 days jail credit. In 15CM64 23 days jail credit. 11:04/11:20

Defendant Brian D. J. Johnston in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CM61 and 15CM64.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 2 of 15CM64 and no contest to 15CM61.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 1 of 15CM64 was Dismissed but read in.  In both cases Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 18 months each.  Conditions of probation include: $443.00 costs each count.  AODA and comply.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Maintain full time work, school, or treatment.  Restitution in 15CM61 in the amount of $201.87.  Submit DNA sample.  No jail credit.  11:45/12:00.
